pullRequest.title: Move release tests and doc to GitHub Actions
pullRequest.bodyText:
Part of #2260
Signed-off-by: Jan Jansen jan.jansen@gdata.de

Thank you for contributing to JanusGraph!
In order to streamline the review of the contribution we ask you
to ensure the following steps have been taken:
For all changes:

 Is there an issue associated with this PR? Is it referenced in the commit message?
 Does your PR body contain #xyz where xyz is the issue number you are trying to resolve?
 Has your PR been rebased against the latest commit within the target branch (typically master)?
 Is your initial contribution a single, squashed commit?

For code changes:

 Have you written and/or updated unit tests to verify your changes?
 If adding new dependencies to the code, are these dependencies licensed in a way that is compatible for inclusion under ASF 2.0?
 If applicable, have you updated the LICENSE.txt file, including the main LICENSE.txt file in the root of this repository?
 If applicable, have you updated the NOTICE.txt file, including the main NOTICE.txt file found in the root of this repository?

For documentation related changes:

 Have you ensured that format looks appropriate for the output in which it is rendered?
 If this PR is a documentation-only change, have you added a [doc only]
tag to the first line of your commit message to avoid spending CPU cycles in
Travis CI when no code, tests, or build configuration are modified?

Note:
Please ensure that once the PR is submitted, you check Travis CI for build issues and submit an update to your PR as soon as possible.

beforeCommit.message:
Move release tests and doc to GitHub Actions

Part of #2260

Signed-off-by: Jan Jansen <jan.jansen@gdata.de>

afterCommit.message:
Move release tests and doc to GitHub Actions

Part of #2260

Signed-off-by: Jan Jansen <jan.jansen@gdata.de>

nodes.bodyText:
Does it mean that we now deploy on master branch only? What about v* branches?
As I understand we can do something like:
on:
  push:
    # Deploy when push to `master` branch and all `v*` branches 
    branches:
      - master
      - v*

And then we could do something like:
push:
    needs: build-doc
    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
    if: github.event_name == 'push'
    ...

I could be wrong, did research GitHub Actions too much yet but as far as I know the above should work and trigger push on master, v0.5, v0.4, etc.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,95 @@
+# Copyright 2020 JanusGraph Authors
+#
+# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+# You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+# limitations under the License.
+
+name: CI Docs
+
+on:
+  pull_request:
+  push:
+
+env:
+  STRUCTOR_VERSION: v1.7.1
+  BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS: "-Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -DskipTests=true --batch-mode --also-make"
+  VERIFY_MAVEN_OPTS: "-Pcoverage"
+
+jobs:
+  build-all:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-maven-
+      - uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - run: mvn clean install --projects janusgraph-all ${{ env.BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS }}
+
+  build-doc:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
+    needs: build-all
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-maven-
+      - uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - run: mvn clean install -pl janusgraph-doc ${{ env.BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS }}
+      - run: git diff  --exit-code docs/basics/janusgraph-cfg.md
+      - run: docker build -t doc-site:mkdocs -f docs/docs.Dockerfile ./docs
+      - run: docker run --rm -v $PWD:/mkdocs doc-site:mkdocs mkdocs build
+      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v2
+        if: github.ref != 'ref/head/master'
+        with:
+          name: distribution-builds
+          path: site
+
+  deploy-doc:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
+    needs: build-doc
+    steps: 
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+        with:
+          fetch-depth: 0
+      - run: mkdir ./bin
+      - run: curl -sfL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/traefik/structor/master/godownloader.sh | bash -s -- -b ./bin ${STRUCTOR_VERSION}
+      # TODO: change --dockerfile-url=".../v0.5/docs.Dockerfile" to --dockerfile-url=".../master/docs/docs.Dockerfile"
+      - run: sudo ./bin/structor -o janusgraph -r janusgraph 
+            --force-edit-url 
+            --rqts-url="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/janusgraph/janusgraph/master/requirements.txt" 
+            --dockerfile-url="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/janusgraph/janusgraph/v0.5/docs.Dockerfile" 
+            --dockerfile-name="default-docs.Dockerfile" 
+            --menu.js-url="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/janusgraph/janusgraph/master/docs/theme/structor-menu.js.gotmpl" 
+            --exp-branch=master --debug
+      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v2
+        if: github.ref != 'ref/head/master'

@@ -197,7 +197,7 @@ git tag -a v0.3.2 -m ""
 #### Create the Pull Request
 
 Open up pull requests for the version updates.
-It is recommended to add `[full build]` to the commit message so the full suite of compatibility tests will run.
+It is recommended to add `[tp-tests]` to the commit message so the tinkerpop test suite will run.

nodes.bodyText: Looks like this should be ci-docs.yml.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,105 @@
+# Copyright 2020 JanusGraph Authors
+#
+# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+# You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#      http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+# limitations under the License.
+
+name: CI Release
+
+on:
+  pull_request:
+    paths-ignore:
+    - 'docs/**'
+    - '.github/workflows/build-deploy-doc.yml'

nodes.bodyText: These are not uploaded on master because we deploy them there completely?
nodes.diffHunk:

+      - run: mvn clean install --projects janusgraph-all ${{ env.BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS }}
+
+  build-doc:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04

+      - uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+          restore-keys: |

+      - uses: actions/setup-java@v1

+      - run: docker build -t doc-site:mkdocs -f docs/docs.Dockerfile ./docs
+      - run: docker run --rm -v $PWD:/mkdocs doc-site:mkdocs mkdocs build
+      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v2
+        if: github.ref != 'ref/head/master'

nodes.bodyText: (nitpick) The variable STRUCTOR_VERSION can now also be removed completely.

Move release tests and doc to GitHub Actions

Part of #2260

Signed-off-by: Jan Jansen <jan.jansen@gdata.de>

nodes.bodyText: When should we change this url? Why not to change it right now? This PR is targeting master branch
nodes.diffHunk:

+

+  pull_request:
+  push:
+
+env:
+  STRUCTOR_VERSION: v1.7.1
+  BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS: "-Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -DskipTests=true --batch-mode --also-make"
+  VERIFY_MAVEN_OPTS: "-Pcoverage"
+
+jobs:
+  build-all:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-maven-
+      - uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - run: mvn clean install --projects janusgraph-all ${{ env.BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS }}
+
+  build-doc:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
+    needs: build-all
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: ~/.m2/repository
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-maven-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-maven-
+      - uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - run: mvn clean install -pl janusgraph-doc ${{ env.BUILD_MAVEN_OPTS }}
+      - run: git diff  --exit-code docs/basics/janusgraph-cfg.md
+      - run: docker build -t doc-site:mkdocs -f docs/docs.Dockerfile ./docs
+      - run: docker run --rm -v $PWD:/mkdocs doc-site:mkdocs mkdocs build
+      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v2
+        if: github.ref != 'ref/head/master'
+        with:
+          name: distribution-builds
+          path: site
+
+  deploy-doc:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
+    if: github.ref == 'ref/head/master'
+    needs: build-doc
+    steps: 
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+        with:
+          fetch-depth: 0
+      - run: mkdir ./bin
+      - run: curl -sfL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/traefik/structor/master/godownloader.sh | bash -s -- -b ./bin ${STRUCTOR_VERSION}
+      # TODO: change --dockerfile-url=".../v0.5/docs.Dockerfile" to --dockerfile-url=".../master/docs/docs.Dockerfile"

nodes.bodyText: Should we use master here instead of v0.5?
nodes.diffHunk:
